verse: After Saul had returned from chasing the Philistines, he was told that David had gone to the wilderness of Engedi.
He gathered 3,000 hardened fighting men from across Israel and sought David in the vicinity of the Rocks of Wild Goats.
When he came to the sheep shelters beside the road, a cave was there, and Saul went inside to relieve himself. Unguarded, he was especially vulnerable to attack.
But immediately afterward, David felt awful about what he had done.
David reprimanded his men, refusing to allow them to attack Saul. At last Saul finished and went outside the cave.
David followed him at a safe distance. When Saul exited the cave, David called out.
Davidâ€™s voice fell silent. Saul could hardly believe his eyes and ears.
David swore this to Saul. Saul went home, and David and his men returned to their hideout.
